page.title: 09HORTICULTURE - BURGHFIELD
page.content: Mrs Hancock answered an advertisement in 1980 when Major Dent of Hillfields wanted someone to restore a Victorian garden. There was an old greenhouse containing a vine in the centre of the plot. That autumn Mrs. Hancock sold some cooking apples from the trees and it was suggested she open a garden centre. She filled the greenhouse with plants and bought a "poly-tunnel" and filled that. The next year she bought another tunnel. She sells plants which like acid soil. She sells herbs, conifers, shrubs, bedding plants, fruit trees and vegetables. She will get special plants if you order them. It is a little business but it is growing becuase people here like gardening in their spare time.
